intro: Cienfuegosia hassleriana, commonly known as the Hassler's cienfuegosia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
